channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole on corner, 25th February
item.description:
There is a growing pothole on the corner as you turn left out of Mary Rose onto Highgrove. Taking the turn wide to avoid this results in you having to go into the other side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mary Rose Avenue, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are numerous potholes in thr road, it really needs resurfacing, 25th February
item.description:
As you turn into Castle Hill Drive the potholes start & continue for a long stretch
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castle Hill Drive, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: People driving on the verge making ruts and dragging mud onto the road, 25th February
item.description:
Outside 239 Arle Road, people are driving on the verge and dragging mud onto the road. It's creating deep ruts in the verge and I'm concerned pipes and wiring for utilities will be damaged. There are bollards on one side (nearest the park) to stop people driving on the verge but there's nothing to stop them on the other side. Could some bollards be put up to stop them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 237, Arle Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain Cover Junction of The Reddings/Grovefield Way roundabout, 25th February
item.description:
S E corner of the Junction of The Reddings/Grovefield Way Roundabout (note this is NOT a mini roundabout despite incorrect signage) . Road surface is broken around drain cover which is sinking, see attached photo. The cover was marked 'STW' (Severn Trent Water?) several months ago but no action has been taken

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Reddings, The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
